results.title: Nickelodeon
results.creator_credit: Peter Bogdanovich, Robert Chartoff, Irwin Winkler and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Heartfelt valentine to early days of moviemaking, with O’Neal literally stumbling into his job as director, and Reynolds as an overnight screen hero. Before making this tribute to the brilliant, haphazard early days of Hollywood filmmaking, director/screenwriter Peter Bogdanovich interviewed several veteran filmmakers including John Ford, Raoul Walsh, Allan Dwan and Howard Hawks.

results.title: Mercury rising
results.creator_credit: Harold Becker, Karen Kehela, Brian Grazer and Universal City Studios Productions
results.brief_description: Simon (Miko Hughes), a nine year old autistic boy cracks a code that has a lot of people worried - MERCURY, the most advanced (and expensive) encryption code the U.S government has. Simon comes across the enigma hidden in a puzzle magazine (an orchestrated move by the NSA who designed MERCURY and wanted to test their brainchild out on real people), and when he calls for the prize triggers an alarm at the National Security Agency. NSA Chief Nicholas Kudrow (Alec Baldwin) hires an assassin to kill Simon, believing this is the only way to stop the threat to national security. The only hope Simon has for survival lies with renegade FBI agent Art Jeffries (Bruce Willis), a man willing to protect the emotionally unpredictable child who has no-one else to turn to when ruthless Federal agents are out to get him. The task will take Jeffries muscle power and Simon’s special ability to be successful. Based on the novel “Simple Simon” by Ryne Douglas Pearson. Cast also includes Chi McBride and Kim Dickens.

results.title: The Russia house
results.creator_credit: Fred Schepisi, Paul Maslansky and Panthe Entertainment
results.brief_description: When Katya (Michelle Pfeiffer), a beautiful Russian book editor attempts to send British publisher Barley Blair (Sean Connery) a manuscript written by “Dante” (Klaus Maria Brandauer), a noted scientist, she unwittingly involves him in a world of international espionage. The explosive manuscript - which, if published in the West could dramatically alter the global balance of world power - is intercepted by the West’s spy-masters, who then send Blair to Russia to gain more information on the mysterious manuscript. But when Blair, who has a deep affection for Russia and its people finds himself falling in love with the beautiful Katya, he must decide whose side he really is on. This adaptation of a novel by John Le Carre was scripted by playwright Tom Stoppard. It features a score by Jerry Goldsmith with Brandon Marsalis as a soloist. Other cast members include James Fox, Roy Scheider, J. T. Walsh and John Mahoney. (Awards: Golden Globe 1991: best actress for Michelle Pfeiffer)

results.title: Charro !
results.creator_credit: Charles M. Warren and National General Pictures
results.brief_description: In Elvis’ 29th film he plays it straight in a Western written and directed by the creator of “Gunsmoke”, “Rawhide” and “The Virginian”. Elvis is cast as ex-outlaw Jess Wade, a man determined to stick to the straight and narrow and reform his ways. Wade is captured by his former band of outlaws. The gang then goes on to terrorise a small town by threatening to use an ornate Mexican canon on the village - a canon which Wade is falsely accused of stealing from the Mexican revolutionary forces. Cast also includes Ina Balin, Victor French, Barbara Werle and Lynn Kellogg. Elvis sings only one song in the movie.

results.title: Secret beyond the door
results.brief_description: In this example of forties Gothic a woman comes to fear the man to whom she is attached. Here Bennett’s husband is an architect who obsessively collects ‘felicitous rooms’ in which women have been murdered, and she realizes that she must uncover the secret of one room that is always kept locked. Lang brings a precise expressionism to bear on this baroque popularization of Freudian psychoanalysis, creating an atmosphere in which the subconscious seems suspended as in a dream or a nightmare. Cast includes Joan Bennett, Michael Redgrave and Anne Revere. Based on the story by Rufus King.

results.title: The Woman in the window
results.creator_credit: Fritz Lang, Nunnally Johnson, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and The Christie Corporation
results.brief_description: In this film noir, one man’s life is turned upside down by an encounter with a stranger. Professor Richard Wanley (Edward G. Robinson), an academic reduced to summer batchelorhood accepts a beautiful woman’s (Joan Bennett) offer of a drink - only to find himself an inadvertent murderer and a pawn in a dreadful roundelay of deception, blackmail, sudden death and suicide. Director Fritz Lang keeps the tension taut, New York sidewalks glistening and the audience guessing. ‘The Woman in the Window’ shows that good and evil are present in all, and that circumstances frequently dictate moral choices. So successful was this movie that Robinson, Lang, leading lady Joan Bennet and baddie Dan Duryea immediately reteamed for ‘Sacrlett Street’. Screenplay by Nunnaly Johnson from the novel ‘Once off guard’ by J. H. Wallis.

results.title: The Enigma of Kaspar Hauser = Jeder fur sich und Gott gegen alle
results.creator_credit: Werner Herzog, Walter Saxer and Werner Herzog Filmproduktion
results.brief_description: Regarded as Herzog’s finest film, “The Enigma of Kasper Hauser” is based on a true story about a 19th Century genius. His origins shrouded in mystery, Kasper Hauser was found wandering the streets of Nuremberg in 1820. Without speech, nor any sign of parentage, Hauser immediately becomes the object of scrutiny from the town authorities. After learning to talk he tells of living in a cellar, displaying no signs of having had any contact with other human beings since childhood. In his attempts to adjust to adult life, he reveals a highly advanced intelligence and alternative, almost prophetic, vision. Herzog demonstrates his fascination with misfits, and as the story develops, the confrontation between innocence and corruption intensifies. Cast includes Bruno S, Walter Ladengast and Brigitte Mira. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Fitzcarraldo
results.creator_credit: Werner Herzog, Lucki Stipetic and Werner Herzog Filmproduktion
results.brief_description: An intense and enthralling portrait of an intrepid and obsessed impresario with a desire to bring both Enrico Caruso and an opera house to the deepest jungles of South America. The highlight of the story is Fitzcarraldo’s Herculean effort to haul a 300-plus ton steamboat over the mountains, for which no trickery was used in filming the gruelling sequence. Director Werner Herzog boldly embarked on the same journey, proving to be as driven and single-purposed as his protagonist, the audience’s knowledge of this adding to the excitement. In German with English subtitles. Cast includes Klaus Kinski, Claudia Cardinale, Jose Lewgoy, Miguel Angel Fuentes and Paul Hittscher.

results.title: Mars attacks! [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Tim Burton, Larry Franco and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Science fiction and cult movie fans will warm to Tim Burton’s distinct brand of humour in this sci-fi spoof where, once again, Earth is invaded by martians. These mean green invaders from the Red Planet have slimey humungous brains, are armed with Instr-ray guns, and are cinematically supported by state-of-the-art special effects. The stars that shine here include Jack Nicholson (in a dual role), Glenn Close, Annette Bening, Pierce Brosnan, Danny DeVito, plus many more notable cameos (including one by Tom Jones).
